review_title: A friendly and encouraging place to work, but with a couple of flaws.
pros:
Like other reviews have stated, Thames Valley Housing is in many ways a really great place to work.

The majority of people are friendly, warm and welcoming and the company is committed to ongoing personal and professional development. 

The company does also punch above its weight for a housing association of its size. 

People also embrace the company values in their day-to-day roles and recently there has been a major push towards improving the way that services are delivered.

The work force is diverse and staff are actively encouraged to mix with colleagues from across the business. 

A large group of people who regularly use the staff intranet also make sure that it's an engaging and fun way of keeping on top of what's going on at Thames Valley Housing.
cons:
There isn't really much room for career progression in the majority of teams, most likely due to the size of the company. 

There are a few members of staff that can be quite difficult and set in their ways, who can also make the smallest of requests seem like a really big deal. However, the majority of people are pleasant to work with and very agreeable.

There was talk after the cancellation of the Genesis merger of adopting some of their policies (such as flexible working) that appear to have fallen by the wayside, at least for the majority of staff.

There's a slight tendency to think that we are more innovative than we perhaps actually are, although steps are being taken to address this. The main problem here is that there's a clash between people looking towards the future and those who feel threatened by the prospect of change.
